text:
Been working on a redis client for the web. This will become the persistence backend of my open source firebase-server implemented *within a browser (i.e. on <http://observablehq.co|observablehq.co>*m*)*. The main thing I am happy with is that I have not had to write an application level proxy for redis. Sadly I did need to use a proxy, but it was a generic websocket -> TCP bridge so it's the kind of infra I can reuse for different things.

As this is a generally useful thing. I am figuring out how to eject an NPM module from <http://observablehq.com|observablehq.com>
